intro: Salvia mexicana var. minor, commonly known as Mexican mint marigold, is a perennial herb native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of small, showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or disturbed soils. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is known for its square stems and aromatic properties. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine.
